description.narrative: By 2017, duty bearers and rights holders have the knowledge and capacity to participate in, promote and adopt changes in social and cultural practices that protect vulnerable children and women.

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Pakistan: End of Programme Evaluation on Promoting Child Rights in Cotton Farming Areas (CRCFA) Programme of Pakistan
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, duty bearers and rights holders have the knowledge and capacity to participate in, promote and adopt changes in social and cultural practices that protect vulnerable children and women.

description.narrative: A C4D strategy supporting adolescent rights to freedom of expression and participation was developed and support for universal birth registration in priority districts of FATA, Punjab and Sindh is underway. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of communication campaigns implemented at national level on key identified issues of child protection
Number of communication strategies on child protection issues developed and implemented at provincial level
# partnerships established including with institutional and community-based actors for strengthening the protective environment for children
Health workers trained on birth registration

baseline.value: 21(LHW's trained during the pilot project in 3 Union Councils of Punjab and Sindh)

title.narrative: % increase in the children registered at birth

baseline.value: Punjab: 77, Sindh: 20, KP: 20, Balochistan: 23, FATA: < 1, ICT: 74.2, GB: 23.3, PAK: 24

target.value: 2017:Punjab: 85, Sindh: 50, KP: 50, Balochistan: 50, FATA: 15, ICT: 85, GB: 50, PAK: 50

actual.value: 2017:Punjab: 72.7% (2014 MICS) Sindh: 29.1% (2014 MICS) KP: n/a (old data 20%, new MICS data will be available in 2017) Balochistan: n/a (old data 23%, new data will be available in 2017) FATA: n/a (old data <1%) ICT: n/a (old data 74.2%) GB: 18.6% (MICS 2017) PAK: n/a (old data 24%)
